title: Google Maps Will Be Deleting Your Location History. Know How To Protect It - NDTV
summary:
Google Maps Will Be Deleting Your Location History. Know How To Protect It

Publication Date: Not specified. Source: Not specified.

Google's Timeline feature, originally known as Location History, will go offline on June 9, 2025, prompting users to save their location data to avoid deletion.

Key Points:

  • Timeline feature changing to save data on devices instead of in the cloud.
  • Data older than three months will be deleted unless saved by the user.
  • 90 days of data will transfer to devices after the deadline.
  • Timeline data won't be accessible on web browsers.
  • Instructions for users to keep Timeline data include updating app settings.

Notable Quotes:

"Timeline is changing and will now be created on your device. You’ll need to choose settings for your data by June 9, 2025 to avoid losing visits and routes."

This shift aims to enhance user privacy, although there are concerns about losing valuable travel data.
newTitle: Google Maps Will Be Deleting Your Location History. Know How To Protect It

Vivo X Fold 3 Pro, Galaxy Z Fold 6, Pixel 9 Pro Fold, and more: How the foldable phone space unfolded in 2024 - The Hindu
summary:
Vivo X Fold 3 Pro, Galaxy Z Fold 6, Pixel 9 Pro Fold, and more: How the foldable phone space unfolded in 2024

Published on: December 16, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The foldable phone market saw significant advancements in 2024, with key players like Vivo, Samsung, and Google launching innovative devices. The year marked the entry of affordable options as well, expanding the foldable phone segment.

  • Vivo launched the X Fold 3 Pro, its first foldable phone in India, featuring cutting-edge specifications.
  • Samsung released the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Z Flip 6, enhancing multitasking capabilities with AI features.
  • Motorola introduced the Razr 50 and Razr 50 Ultra, emphasizing design and functionality.
  • Google debuted its first foldable, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold, integrating various AI functionalities.
  • Affordable foldables from Infinix and Tecno also hit the market, broadening consumer access.
Vivo X Fold 3 Pro was priced at ₹1,59,999, while Samsung's Galaxy Z Fold 6 launched at ₹1,64,999.

This year's developments suggest a promising future for foldable technology, combining innovation with user-friendly designs.
newTitle: Foldable Phones in 2024: A Comprehensive Overview

Apple’s Foldable iPhone May Debut In 2026, Foldable iPad In 2028 - NDTV Profit
summary:
Apple’s Foldable iPhone May Debut In 2026, Foldable iPad In 2028

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Industry Reports

Apple is reportedly working on foldable devices with a potential launch for the foldable iPhone in 2026, followed by a foldable iPad in 2028.

  • The foldable iPhone could feature a 7-inch display and a flexible OLED screen.
  • Apple aims to create a thinner device, moving away from yearly cosmetic changes.
  • The foldable iPad will likely function as a large device equivalent to two iPad Pros side-by-side.
  • Both devices are being designed to minimize or eliminate screen creasing.
Mark Gurman noted the foldable iPad is a “single, uninterrupted piece of glass.”

In conclusion, Apple’s new foldable devices aim to redefine portable tech, enhancing user experience with innovative designs.
newTitle: Apple’s Foldable iPhone May Debut In 2026, Foldable iPad In 2028

title: The trouble with searching Google for ‘the best’ | Mint - Mint
summary:
The Trouble with Searching Google for 'The Best'

Publication Date: N/A
Source: Mint

Shoppers often hit Google to search things like “top vacuums” or “best dishwashers,” expecting fair, independent assessments of top models. Instead, they might land on marketing pages disguised as expert rankings.

  • Marketing tactics lead consumers to misleading ranking sites.
  • Ads promoting non-reputable products often appear in search results.
"Some firms buy Google ads to promote these 'ratings' sites as a quick way to steer customers to pricey off-brand products and potential rip-offs."

This trend raises concerns about the reliability of search results when consumers are seeking genuine recommendations.
newTitle: The Trouble with Searching Google for 'The Best'

Villa companies set to greet a happy holiday season on uptick in Christmas, New Year travel | Today News - Mint
summary:
Villa companies set to greet a happy holiday season on uptick in Christmas, New Year travel

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: Today News

As the year ends, villa rental companies are gearing up for a busy season, buoyed by extended travel plans with both Christmas and New Year falling on weekdays.

  • Villa rental companies report increased bookings due to midweek holidays.
  • Travelers are extending their stays, often from Saturday to Tuesday or Sunday to Wednesday.
  • Occupancy rates during this period are at their highest for the year.
"Occupancies at this time are at the year's best," said Devendra Parulekar, co-founder of SaffronStays.

This holiday season is shaping up to be one of the busiest for villa rental companies, as families and groups take advantage of the longer stays and festive spirit.
newTitle: Villa Companies Prepare for Holiday Travel Surge

Apple Intelligence falsely attributed fake news to BBC, broadcaster alleges in complaint - The Indian Express
summary:
Apple Intelligence Falsely Attributed Fake News to BBC, Broadcaster Alleges in Complaint

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

A week after the launch of Apple Intelligence in the UK, a complaint was filed by the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) due to an incident involving AI-generated fake news attributed to their platform.

  • The complaint focused on a false AI-generated report claiming Luigi Mangione had died by suicide, incorrectly stating that it was published by the BBC.
  • Luigi Mangione, who has been charged with murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, is currently in custody.
  • The BBC expressed concerns over the trustworthiness of their news being misrepresented and has communicated with Apple to resolve the issue.
  • There were also inaccuracies related to content summarization from The New York Times, including a false claim regarding the arrest of Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu.
“BBC News is the most trusted news media in the world. It is essential to us that our audiences can trust any information or journalism published in our name.” – BBC Spokesperson

This incident raises significant questions about the reliability of AI in disseminating news and the potential consequences of misinformation.
newTitle: Apple Intelligence Falsely Attributed Fake News to BBC, Broadcaster Alleges in Complaint

summary:
Lava Blaze Duo 5G With 1.58-Inch Rear Display Launched in India: See Price

Publication Date: Friday, Source: Gadgets 360

The Lava Blaze Duo 5G features a unique secondary display on the rear and is powered by a MediaTek Dimensity 7025 processor.

  • Price in India starts at ₹18,999 for the base model with 6GB RAM and 128GB storage.
  • Available in Arctic White and Celestial Blue colors.
  • Sales start on December 20 via Amazon, with promotional prices of ₹16,999 and ₹17,999 for different variants.
  • Features a 6.67-inch AMOLED display, 64MP rear camera, and 16MP front camera.
  • Includes a 5,000mAh battery with 33W fast charging and an IP64 rating for dust and splash resistance.
“HDFC Bank debit and credit cardholders can avail a ₹2,000 instant discount on purchase.”

In conclusion, the Lava Blaze Duo 5G combines modern display technology with competitive pricing, making it a noteworthy entry in the budget smartphone segment.
newTitle: Lava Blaze Duo 5G Launched in India: Price and Features Revealed

title: OnePlus Ace 5, OnePlus Ace 5 Pro Pre-Reservations Begin; May Launch on December 26 - Gadgets 360

OnePlus Ace 5 Series Pre-Reservations Begin; Launch Date Tipped

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Gadgets 360

OnePlus has opened pre-reservations for its Ace 5 series smartphones, set to launch in China, confirmed to feature powerful specifications including Snapdragon 8 chipsets and various RAM/storage options.

  • Pre-reservations are available through OnePlus's official online store in China.
  • Model configurations include options up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage.
  • The OnePlus Ace 5 will use Snapdragon 8 Gen 3, and the Pro version will utilize Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC.
  • The expected launch date is December 26, as indicated by a Chinese tipster.
  • The devices feature a 6.78-inch display, a robust camera setup, and substantial battery capacity with fast charging.
“The OnePlus Ace 5 series will launch on December 26.”

As anticipation builds, the Ace 5 series promises significant upgrades, positioning itself as a competitive offering in the smartphone market.

title: iOS 18.2 update enhances Find My feature to recover lost items; here’s how it works - CNBCTV18
summary:
iOS 18.2 Update Enhances Find My Feature for Recovering Lost Items

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: CNBC TV18

Apple’s iOS 18.2 update introduces exciting new features, notably an enhanced 'Find My' function that allows users to share the location of lost items easily.

  • The update enables users to share the location of their lost items through the Find My app.
  • Users can generate a link for sharing, which doesn’t require the recipient to have an Apple device.
  • The shared link expires after one week or when the item is found.
  • A new ‘Show Contact Info’ option lets recipients view the owner's contact details.
  • The update is available to all devices supporting iOS 18, but certain features are exclusive to the iPhone 15 Pro and 16 series.
“The best part of the upgrade is that the recipient doesn’t need an Apple device to access the location of the lost item.”

In conclusion, the iOS 18.2 update significantly improves the Find My feature, making it easier for users to retrieve lost items.
newTitle: iOS 18.2 Update Enhances Find My Feature for Recovering Lost Items

title: WhatsApp Will Soon Get A Dialer On iPhones To Make It Easy For Calls: Know More - News18
summary:
WhatsApp Will Soon Get A Dialer On iPhones To Make It Easy For Calls

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: News18

WhatsApp is enhancing its app for iPhone users by introducing a dialer tab, aimed at consolidating messaging and calling functions within the app, allowing users to make calls directly from it.

  • WhatsApp will introduce a dialer tab for iPhone users.
  • This feature allows users to call others without leaving the WhatsApp app.
  • The dialer will open when clicking the + icon on the WhatsApp feed.
  • The feature is also aimed to enhance the app's integration for users, as available on Android.
  • WhatsApp will limit calls to the app's ecosystem, potentially creating issues in regions heavily reliant on traditional calling.
  • Recent updates have improved video call quality and group calling functionalities.
“Having its own dialer app means WhatsApp users don’t need to rely on the default dialer that is provided by Google and Apple.”

This new dialer feature aims to provide a more integrated experience for WhatsApp users on iPhones, though it may have limitations in markets where traditional phones dominate.
newTitle: WhatsApp Will Soon Get A Dialer On iPhones To Make It Easy For Calls
